Enhanced biometric security: By incorporating more advanced fingerprint or iris recognition systems, smartphones can enhance user security and privacy, making authentication more secure and efficient.
Augmented reality (AR) features: Merge smartphone cameras with AR technology to create interactive and engaging experiences, such as 3D games or virtual shopping.
Improved battery performance: Develop a new, more efficient battery technology or enhance the current one, increasing battery life and reducing the need to recharge frequently.
Enhanced camera capabilities: By incorporating more advanced image processing, high-resolution sensors, and improved lens designs, smartphones can produce better quality photos and videos.
Smart home integration: Make smartphones act as universal remotes for controlling and monitoring smart home devices, such as smart locks, thermostats, and security systems.
